-XePmA8YjRT_xIh9n8kVnQ.text: Decent but not nothing to write home about. We have went three times and the food is decent but the atmosphere is not amazing. A average restaurant

ftvXGd9WaAskZmxqLI6Wpw.text: We love Enrico's.  Great flavors, generous portions (good to split), and the pizza!  Just yum!!

A1atciz3bstTgs_jB-5pWg.text: Love Enrico's. This place is probably the most legit pizza place in Charlotte, especially in the steel creek area. I have eaten here a couple times, but normally stick to take out. My family has tried the pizza (pepperoni), Stromboli (regular), and wings (blackened and texmex). We love that their wings are nice and crispy and so flavorful! And the Stromboli is oozing with deliciousness . The pizza is very good as well. They put the right amount of sauce and I like that the pepperoni is made of beef and not pork. If they keep up with the quality that I've seen so far, I'm sure this place will remain/ become a staple for many others.

bj5FLBzwl0Y7b6LXlwSmjw.text: I had been meaning to dine at Enrico's for some time but finally visited recently.  The restaurant exterior is beautiful, the interior is simple and charming, and the patio is small but attractive.  I dined outside on the patio.  The menu has plenty of selections but none that really jumped out me.  I wanted mussels but it is served with a red sauce, when asked, the kitchen said they could use a garlic and lemon sauce instead which was appealing.  The pizza sizes were too large for a single diner so I opted to forego that.  The calzone and stromboli were appealing but I did not like the price point.  The shrimp scampi appetizer seemed amazing but the entree size had different ingredients that did not appeal to me.  However, the party seated next to me were served spaghetti that looked good and smelled incredible.  Ultimately, I selected the shrimp appetizer but has an entree size with a Caesar salad and cup of hot water.    I had to request silverware and received a black cloth napkin which I liked.  However, when I unraveled the napkin, it had hair and crumbs on it.  The replacement was utensils wrapped in a paper napkin, which was ok but I preferred a clean fresh smelling black cloth napkin.  I received the cup of water, inserted a tea bag but it never steeped.  When I checked the water is was lukewarm and lipstick was on the cup.  When I was finally able to reach my service I asked for very hot water in a clean cup.    I receive the Caesar salad but the dressing had an overwhelming taste of mayo that I did not care for.  Also, it did not have croutons and I really wish they were included.  I received my entree while I was still eating the salad.  I wish many restaurants did a better job of timing the courses.  After finishing the salad, I moved to the entree of shrimp scampi.  When I tell you it was a gorgeous dish, believe me.  The fettucine pasta was light, the sauce was plentiful with lots of flavor, the shrimp were big and beautiful; I could not have asked for more.  Also, the entree was served with warm rolls and butter.  I was in heaven and savored every bite.  Although I loved my entree, I gave the restaurant 4 out of 5 stars because my server.  The server was not attentive, it seemed as though I was a bother to her, at the end of my dinner a different server came to me to say my initial server had an emergency and left which was fine because she wasn't of much help to me.  The deduction of one star is also because of the salad dressing, dirty napkin, unclean cup, and lukewarm water.  Will return to Enrico's, heck yeah.  Do I recommend Enrico's to others, definitely.

ltF_6BkQJJYki_dbWvzjgQ.text: I really expected more wirh the reviews....the waiter was awesome and the stars are for his attentive service. ...bravo.  The food....well....pasta rule #1 salt the water or its like eating paste....the vodka sauce was fair...the Penne special was bland to the point i used half of the grated cheese from table shaker...and added salt and pepper and red pepper so it was ok..... Tiramisu claimed to be homemade but there was a distinct "old fridge" taste that may haunt me for awhile....it was not well put together lacking in the lady fingers soaked in coffee (or coffee liquor) and surely no mascapone either.  Steer clear if your palate is beyond chain food fare....

nnBcLymQn--caYRrHcOUtw.text: This used to be one of my favorite places to have dinner. After some False advertisement on their website of 20% off if ordering online, I was treated very unprofessionally by the management staff. When I went inside the store to try to communicate the issue that I was having with the online ordering system, I was surprised by the disrespectful communication from the management. In lieu of offering some compensation for my inconvenience, I was confronted with yelling and very unprofessional behavior from the staff. I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau in an attempt to assist this organization with better transparency in advertising and False advertising tactics. I was very disappointed, as their food is absolutely wonderful! I believe that their staff could use some training on professionalism and courteous customer service. If consideration for there patrons were more positive and professional, I would absolutely give them five stars.

Ii5VrlSaV9D1DYmv0vjGFQ.text: This food is straight up garbage. Extra bland if you want boiled chicken this is the place to go. I haven't ate boil chicken since my grandmother made us chicken noodle soup. boil chicken on pizza nasty they  put boiled  chicken on  pasta nasty use your grill or bake it fry it I don't care. I'm convinced that people living in Charlotte either don't care what they eat or they just don't know better

K9CPpOPG2TswwRO_nEvS6A.text: We have eaten here 3 times now and we love it! Very good little Italian place. Little disappointed that the menu got changed, I get the sandwich and they took the fries off as the included side and are just doing a bag of lays chips now! My fiance got the shrimp scampi and it was a decent size and had excellent flavor, wasn't to oily. The tails were left on the shrimp though so you have to detail them before you can eat it. Can't wait to to back and try other things!

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States

13GNINseOVP1NTuoJcyfMg.text: I see a lot of 4 and 5 star ratings for this restaurant. While this is a fine place to eat, it doesn't stand out. The first thing I noticed was the interior has some nice design to it, but the floor is tile and that makes the sound level in the restaurant pretty high. I felt like this would be a great brewery or tap room, not a sit down restaurant. The loudness was probably the most distinctive thing about my meal. Since they recently opened, they only had 4 red wine options and 2 beers (no draft). The waitress said they were soon to get 3 local craft beers. Hopefully that happens, because a place without a local craft beer option, is off the list.  We were seated promptly when we arrived. There was no wait line. We had immediate service. That was good. They have a decent selection of appetizers, the waitress recommended Calamari, so we had that. The Calamari was typical, not outstanding, not a lot of flavor, but also not fried to death, so it was A-ok. (3 stars) We had a bottle of wine, selected from the 4 options. It was fine. Next to the menu! They had a large selection of dishes. Lots of pasta options, pizza, Calzones, Stromboli, and other entrees as well. I had Premivera with Broccoli, mushrooms, Spinach in a cream sauce and I added Meatballs. It was fairly priced and tasted A-ok. It wasn't super tasty. It wasn't really memorable. But not terrible either. Now, it was a YUGE portion. It was easily 4x what I could eat. I always hate going to a place, eating my fill, and then realizing, it looks like I barely touched my main dish. I can't imagine anyone eating a full portion. Similar experience from my family. Portions were very large, quality and taste were A-ok, but not outstanding. To Dessert! We got a Tiramishu and a cheese cake. Both, again, A-ok. So, in conclusion. This isn't a bad place, its a fine place, and we need a new place in this area. However, I wouldn't make this a date night location. Its a solid 3 stars.

A5D4VZ5jdN492WDzOBg23w.text: We stopped here for dinner before shopping at the outlets, and it exceeded our expectations (even after reading the great reviews)! The cheese bread and pizza were delicious, the service was great and the atmosphere was the perfect blend of classy and casual. We will certainly be back when we're in the area!

UZ2Kd3UYU0xSbKOZhw03-w.text: Let me keep it short and simple..... - The decor of the restaurant was very nice.  - Everything the eye can see was clean. - Great customer service. We came across a few issues with our order but the waitress did not hesitate on helping us out. - The food was alright. Really would be nice to have fresh veggies and not those from a can.   I was kind of looking forward to eating a more authentic/homemade meal.  I would recommend visiting Enrico's for an appetizer and drinks.   I have been to Papa Sammy's Pizza in Mount Holly, NC and food is way better. The variety of food is not as extensive as the food listed on Enrico's menu but at least many of the food items are homemade and there are many fresh ingredients in their dishes.

PpsYfwTYQYpObvw_7JDrAw.text: so excited to have this place in the neighborhood. We ordered a margherita pie and some salads to go. The pizza is just as good, if not better than my favorite margherita pie from NJ and that's saying a LOT. I never thought I'd see the day where I'd love pizza in Charlotte- this beats all places by far. it's the real deal. They have pasta dishes, calzones, hot and cold sandwiches, etc. Can't wait to eat my way through the menu!

There is nothing fresh about made here. I gave this place 3 tries and the three times I came I left discussed with the food. It is safe to say that I am  not coming here any more.    Another thing, I don't know who this guys is, if the manager or owner but he has this angry face thats makes anyone feel uncomfortable and it definitely not welcoming.

NZLL7ACfaEdO6hskiDuzuw.text: Been here 3 times and actually seems to gets better every visit we make . Great service, fresh food and good drinks can't ask for much more than that and their prices are very reasonable. Definitely in the top 5 best  Italian restaurants in the Charlotte area.

68Wne2pQQj6qFIMbFFDnZg.text: Service is always fantastic and the food is delicious. Best penne vodka I've ever had!

hf2ZStYzTcxHHKfTwRBRkw.text: We had a great dinner here tonight!  I had a pizza with prosciutto and arugula, and it was delicious!  My husband had a Stromboli which he also enjoyed. However, he did mention that he had to eat through quite a bit of crust before he got to the toppings.  The service was very good and the prices are reasonable.  We are looking forward to coming back and trying more of the menu!

Wl_FlJFmASuPo5DesSXMHQ.text: Service iffy but food was great worth the portion  Would like to see more on menu but overall I would recommend

a3ltEv_nx0qJ8sECbJL_HA.text: Great Italian food!! Great Service!! Great wine and beer on tap! I've have lunch and dinner here many times since the summer. Highly recommend you take the time to relax here for a good meal and nice atmosphere!!!

OqC1Vz_nHuciQJj8eQDDaQ.text: Food is good but management is horrible! Tony is rude and has been witnessed blowing his nose near the food!

xOeoC5BQ4HvkmdeUaOS5xw.text: Great food and April was phenomenal!! The calzone is on point. Will always come back here !!

mYU8EAjaqfbTqQo-b9Dh2w.text: Friends have been raving about this place, tried it for lunch and loved it!!! Ordered the spinach/chicken lasagna and my husband ordered chicken parm, with an order of garlic nots. Its a great portion and the sauce was amazing!! Highly recomend it

MFtCVZ598P__ydQz4L0Dkg.text: For Steele Creek, I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. I am pretty underwhelmed by the Italian restaurants in Charlotte. Mama Ricotta's is outstanding, but I have yet to find another Italian restaurant I would say is even above average.   The decor has a nice modern rustic feel to it. There was no wait and only a handful of people there when we went. The service was fast and friendly.   You get a ton of food. You start with bread, which I thought was pretty good. All of the pasta dishes come with a side salad. They used a spring mix which I'm always a fan of and the balsamic vinaigrette was very good. The portions of the pasta dishes are huge. It would definitely make sense to split them between two people. We got the penne vodka and the gnocchi. Both were pretty good. I wouldn't say they were outstanding, but good solid pasta dishes. My friend got the Sorrento and it was very fresh and pretty good as well.  We finished with the seasonal sweet potato maple cheesecake which was delicious!  This isn't a place I would rave about, but it was definitely enjoyable and raises the bar for restaurants in Steele Creek and Italian restaurants in Charlotte.

d3ugp_O9uXW72TqViFsYRg.text: I have been searching high and low to find an italian spot on my side of town to replace house of pizza who in my opinion has the best lasagna dinner!!! Everything from the bread on down. I was just a little dis appointed that i still have not found that here at Enricos! The customer service here is definetly top notch the lasagna was ok but nothing to brag about i was expecting to have the loaf buttery garlic bread when instead the lasagna dinner came with  italian rolls and butter, i will say their bar area inside of this place definetly stands out and i would frequent this spot for a glass of wine or so, i want to come back here and try the crab and spinach dip appetizer. With all of that being said i am still on a hunt to find a great italian spot that i will be head over heels for ! Arrivederci for now .

PAMRZUXlICWtkebriNU_WQ.text: Delicious! Mary was terrific and we will definitely be requesting her again the next time we visit. Food portions were larger than expected, flavor was exquisite and the atmosphere was really fun. Just moved from the west coast and very happy I found this place cause I'll be back again very soon.

Xx7xlB93xXnRDwz3BG1TrQ.text: Small restaurant with big taste!! The food quality and preparation in on par with any of the big name white tablecloth Italian restaurants in town. What separates Enricos from the rest is reasonable pricing and laidback atmosphere as well as tremendous menu filled with awesome food. Hint* try the bolognese over angle hair past.

LtELJpL1t1MWsYqeiqAWPA.text: Great food everytime.  Affordable prices for good Italian food. We eat there all the time.

l3GPfzSKT86hE0tpHs37uQ.text: Amazing authentic Italian food, and that's coming from a New Yorker. So surprised to find this place in NC!

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Parm with Angel Hair (after I destroyed it!) Soooooo good!

tPJQKR5NIVud4OUAVHGcCA.text: Good value for the money.  Stromboli and seafood pasta were excellent.  Probably a little too noisy for large groups or for meeting where discussions are needed.

wHNN1kDko2m-_xGX9FOhlg.text: Totally craving pizza with the girls and we got what we wanted! Popping boboas was a bonus! #win

y6G361KOQq1_Z9nJbCftxA.text: Stayed in the area for one night and needed a place to eat near our hotel. Wasn't expecting much, but was very pleasantly surprised. Food was great (fresh baked, warm, dinner rolls!), service was very friendly and very attentive. Prices were very reasonable ($55 for dinner for 4, including salad, entree and soda).  Will definitely go back if we're in the area again!

7SqaL8WwlAyXsOkTmDoBUw.text: Great food and service, huge portions  My wife and I went here for dinner tonight.  We like trying new restaurants, and I am so glad we gave this one a shot.  The location is convenient and the ambience is great.  It is a tad loud in there because of the concrete floors and all of the glass, but it is not a big deal.  My family previously owned an Italian restaurant so I am picky when it comes to Italian food.  The meal was EXCELLENT!!  The fried calamari appears to be double dredged before being cooked and they were excellent.  I had the Arrabiata and it had so many flavors going on at once, but they all worked great together.  I am not usually even a red sauce fan but theirs was flavorful with just a great hint of spice, and the prosciutto, olives and mushrooms put it over the edge.  My wife had the linguini and clam sauce.  There had to be 15-20 huge clams in the shell in it still (vs. other restaurants that just used canned clams).  It was flavorful and fresh and she can't wait to eat the leftovers because linguini with clam sauce is always better the next day.  Speaking of leftovers....the portions are huge.  We have a full serving of calamari still left, and over half of each of our dinners (which came with soup or salad).  The meal total for the big app, 2 big dinners with soup/salad, 2 beers and a glass of wine was around $60.  GREAT value.    Can't wait to go back.  A diamond in the rough and the best Italian food we have had in Charlotte (and we have been to many Italian restaurants in town).

m14NgtRZ06NziSc_6-KMaw.text: Sicilian pizza was fabulous!!!   Loved the Blackened Chicken Special also!    Great service and atmosphere.

UGfnrY0t7RlfrGEfuwhhmQ.text: Not bad if you're looking to get some Italian "style" pizza. I usually get the penne alla vodka and I like it. However it doesn't leave me wanting more. I think it works for me because it's close by, but it's rare for me to crave anything from the establishment.

rLIyv32sT7B04rtX0-5vFw.text: I've been here at least a half dozen times since my first visit. I've bounced around the menu trying something different each time. I haven't tried the pizza yet but it sure looks good! Maybe tomorrow ... :)

kp5wC3IAtoKy_xBReBk9-A.text: Delicious!! We had the blackened chicken pasta and the vegetarian pizza, both were excellent.  We stopped in after shopping at the Premium Outlets, we will definitely make the thirty minute drive just to eat here again. DELICIOUS!

JCt_lqNYgeWeGOmBDYg0hg.text: I really feel this place is getting worse in my opinion. We do take out often because it's right down the street but I think I'm done. We have had hair in our food twice. Last order unsure if chicken was cooked looked little pink, I heated it up just in case. The vodka sauce is so inconsistent when we order. The Alfredo is ok but needs more flavor. Piccata is terrible has no flavor at all. The pizza not a fan tried both styles and it's too salty and some seasoning on there I don't care for. The only thing that's awesome are the cannoli! I can't comment on service as we always do take out other than the young girl is pleasant but the guy usually is not.

P8Z7ZZYOlX0QDseTJqknUQ.text: I can't get over how nice the staff is. The food and atmosphere are great too! We have been here 4 times already and it's always consistent. I highly recommend this place! It's a welcomed, much needed addition to this area.

jP1a_LVIBK2FOAVA7lVe5g.text: Usually, we love Enricos, but our most recent take out order was a bit of a disappointment. I order the same meal every time, this time my meal was less than half the size it usually is. It was a fraction of the size of my husband's meal. For one of the most expensive meals on the menu, it was a let down to say the least.

PZKZVaGAuuyTa0hPyytAVg.text: Great food! Service was great! Staff was very friendly and atmosphere was very pleasant! A great neighborhood family place!

ZcKBW07S1zIFPM2VxjrhSQ.text: 2nd time dining in. First time my husband and I ordered lasagna and baked ziti; we usually don't eat these dishes so it was hard to gauge how tasty it was...I would say it was good, not bad and not the best. Service was slow however they had just opened that weekend so pass there.   This time i ordered linguine in white clam sauce...LOVED it, could've used more pasta though was my only complaint. The clams and sauce were delicious. Got a Manhattan clam chowder with it...SO good with plentiful clams. (I was feeling clammy). Husband got a pizza; he didn't like it- sauce and dough were not how he likes his pizza. My brother got a Philly cheesesteak with fries, he said it wasn't bad however not the best. service was attentive however got slow at the end when it came to paying/waiting for card back which can be bothersome especially when you're full and ready to go. I will definitely be back to taste other items on the menu...still thinking about the clam sauce!

uaHtLpH7GQ6mp4tlvUXevA.text: Really enjoyed the wine, the shrimp primavera, and the salad. Portion sizes were plenty for me to pack for lunch the next day. Wonderful to have this in Steele Creek!

vALQbwrpMriYPy6d3IN2JQ.text: Chad and the entire staff is amazing!!! The owner his self is fabulous! So great to have this establishment in our neighborhood!! Love love!!!

xtoibXIpNkvM52pfGr0-xg.text: OMGASSSHHH. The food is amazing. I ordered the tortellini alfredo and added chicken with a side salad. The meat was tender, the pasta was perfectly cooked and the salad dressing tastes homemade. I had bite squad delivery and they were able to bring my food fast because Enricos had it prepared quickly. I love authentic Italian food being raised up north, this place might be my go to. I cannot wait to order more!!!

a_GEwQzsuS8BV7BQ4WKU-w.text: The food was spectacular, at least what I had. Only one minor complaint. It's incredibly loud in the place when everyone gets to talking, however, once you get your food, you forget all about it.

-AgbNxw6URRnvWz5pvAf5g.text: The service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious! Prices were incredibly reasonable as well.

3STsETfDWrHmbjQwG2ppHw.text: I love this place. The food is great, the service is great and this is just what the area needed. There is fast food all over so it's nice to have a bit of a nicer sit down place. Everything I have had there I have enjoyed, gnocchi, pizza, salad, and the garlic knots are awesome. I highly recommend trying this place

P9eXoS_AJGoDqlGotVm5mg.text: We had the garlic cheese bread, chicken parm sub and Stromboli. Both were excellent. Clean, quick service and large portions all around.

w2pBe6eLPHCoHAjOuEc9EQ.text: Has potential but needs to step it up a bit. Great to have a sit down restaurant in the area.  Inside was loud- could use something to soften the noise. Patio is a nice addition although the small lawn allowed patrons to let their kids run and shout- not conducive to a grown up quiet dinner. Server was friendly and attentive and knew the menu. Bread could have been served with a plate for dipping. Both olive oil and salad dressing were served in cheap plastic tubs- it would be classier and more environmentally friendly to use a nicer reusable bowl. Shrimp pasta special was amazing! Veal Saltimbocca was less so. Prosciutto was more like thick Canadian bacon, and the whole thing was covered in a huge gooey wad of bland mozzarella and spinach. Put on a large bed of spaghetti- the whole dish seemed thrown together, and like a tacky version of what could be a tasty Italian favorite. We will go back for sure, but might stick with local favorites like pizza and pasta. I don't think I would risk disappointment by trying the more traditional Italian trattoria fare. With some work this can be a real gem!

E99D_kuXPaaTh_nVn-ivRg.text: Just finished an afternoon of shopping at the nearby outlets and we turned to Yelp to find a place to eat. This is the "sit down" restaurant we found. However, this is probably the best Italian food we have had in the Carolinas. It tasted extremely fresh from the bread, to the salad, to the entrees. I had the lasagna, which was not made like a traditional one, but was extremely tasty and fresh. My wife had the blackened chicken special and it was done perfectly as well. Overall, highly recommend this place, even if you're not at the outlets shopping. It's worth the trip!

GUU04m6poWwgp-C_Kb1bIg.text: This place is really good! I've been here 3 times already, tried 3 different things and each was great. Everyone I went with has also gone back. Prices are very reasonable. Lunchtime service is iffy---twice great, another time not so much. But the food is worth the wait.

rnkqgkz4nt2Ko6dUnMZ2eQ.text: Love love love the food! Staff was super nice very clean decor.   They make everything in house folks!  My lunch was so darn good I had to order some meatballs to go!

Ouqf8WoYsgxMMzdXGImniw.text: Environment: This place looks so so cute on the outside. Very misleading. Although it's also very cute on the inside, the look of the exteriors leading one to believe that it is semi fancy. When in fact, the interior looks for like a nicer pizzas joint. Now don't get me wrong, pizza is my love language, but we were expecting a nice small Italian restaurant.   Food: Although they give you nice large portions the food is not great. I ordered linguine and meatballs and the entire dish lacked flavor. My cousins ordered Shrimp Scampi and Alfredo. With every bite we were adding salt and the only option for cheese to top our dishes was powdered parm. But I will says, the crab and artichoke dip was AMAZING!   Drinks: We orders the special, a Berry Pearl Martini. Oh gosh, it was glorified snow cone syrup with jelly pearls you would find in bubble tea with a splash of alcohol. Not good.   Thankful the service was good! My poor cousin was sick the rest of the night and into the morning with a rolling stomach.   Maybe pass on this restaurant until they decided to just do pizza.

KdHgP8PIThua_tq_loqhYQ.text: Ordered a Large Stromboli with $2 add on of Italian Sausage. It came out without Pepperoni and Ham. All it had was the Mozzarella and Italian Sausage. I started eating from the ends and noticed it missing and thought it was in the center portion. I then noticed as I went that it was missing. I let Brenda P. know about it and she went to the back. She said something messed up on the computer. I asked if I still had to pay for this and she said yes and that she was sorry. She asked if I wanted the toppings brought out on the side. I just said bring me a box. I will not be back. At the beginning I said I wanted to add an additional topping to the Stromboli. On top of that they still charged me $2 for the extra topping even though I was short the other 2 toppings.

1BjeNamvzqsgkUz0RKcTMg.text: I was really impressed with this place after trying it on post mates for the first time. I got a Sicilian pizza which was incredible and could feed an army, a Caesar salad which was perfect, and The crab dip which came with the most delicious garlic bread. I was also really happy with how the order was packaged because I had everything I needed. I will definitely be ordering from them again the food was great!

EeizhzKypB3cj4E4hsKJLg.text: Excellent Italian restaurant and the one person in our group that is gluten free had many good choices.  Serving sizes were quite large, good for any appetite. Will definitely go again.

GcYHARMTsCfXid-JOAr1KA.text: Solid spot for Italian, not the best you'll ever have but definitely never a bad choice for some grub. The pizzas are pretty good (7/10 probably) and the chicken parmesan is fire (8/10). Garlic knots and salads are worth a mention too, not bad. Over all good spot, would recommend.

lo1avH9MeYl6yGfe5TWQhA.text: First time visit and I was very disappointed after hearing good things about the place. Service was not good...... server did not introduce herself, did not offer a pasta selection, had to ask for things twice for example to go boxes. They started mopping the floors at 9:30 and it is hard to eat with strong clean odors soooo strong as soon as I put my food in the to go box I was outside to breathe. Need a liquor menu why have full bar.but no menu. The server could not find the manager  when we had issues with the bill. The veal parmigiana and Baked ziti was good but the salmon dish my friend had was cold.

_PkN3-x9kYpBHpVwm6RexA.text: Incredible pasta - probably the best marina sauce I've ever had outside of Italy. Also, the arugula salad was delicious. Very reasonably priced. We had the food delivered via Uber Eats, so can't comment on the service or atmosphere.

f4t9ufjlHsLOP4ycfvPC7A.text: I really enjoyed my meal here! I tried a beer from tap then another bottled. Both were new IPA's to me! An IPA from Green Man Brewery out of Asheville was on tap and FCA IPA bottled from Railhouse Brewery out of Aberdeen! I liked the Green Man best! We ordered the Crab and Spinach Dip for an appetizer. It came with garlic bread. In my opinion, it was a tad too soupy but the flavor was good. Not much crab or spinach though. I ordered Gnocchi and my daughter ordered Alfredo. Both were excellent with plenty to bring home. We ordered three cannolis to go and they were awesome! We sat at the bar and service could not have been any better! Next time I'm at the Charlotte Premium Outlets, I'll definitely stop by to eat and drink again. I highly recommend this place before or after shopping!

_7fnxY9U_FhAPiVTwkjmLg.text: Cute and modern little place! We had a very friendly server, the food is priced right and portions are definitely Italian sized. It was also delicious and a nice wine selection. I would go again and definitely recommend. Good for families, week night dates, take out and homemade desert.

4zL7Y8uh46qpmBt5STpyNQ.text: Went middle of day.  Had chick parm and veal parm entrees.  Excellent flavor.  Sauce was very tasty.  Big portions.  Rolls made in house.  Service very nice.  Good location.  Only other Italian I go to is Mama Ricotta and that's a drive in traffic from Lake Wylie.  This will be my new go to.  Please keep up the service and food.  Don't let it slide.   Please.  Can't wait to try pizza next. Read Nora Gs review.  Sounds to me like it's a promo review for Sammy's.

oMP_MUiX_BB02-sS6gu8GA.text: I ordered online and went to pick up my food and the dude was rude. Super rude. Never again

HFqbPU6B_uSfs7_Zhd1LEQ.text: Rude as fuck. Placed an online order. Went to pick it up and it was wrong. Asked for what I wanted and was told "don't get mad at me". First of all I want even mad. That's not how you talk to someone who is spending money at your establishment. Won't be returning

HOrwpY35BoKomNNPP103vw.text: I absolutely am a  fan of everything Enrico's! I feel like family every time I come in! Either for a take-out or eat in.  They remember your name and favorite order can't wait for our next meal!!

BKGkl1EhBC9yxOgIaVH3IA.text: This place is right near my apartment, so came for convenience.  First visit, food was decent, but service was lacking.  Server was more focused on her boyfriend than providing customers good service.  Second visit, found a hair in my food and sent it back.  Soon after, watched bearded owner reach toward his mouth as he walked back to kitchen from pizza area.  Was disgusted.  Hair in food looked like it was from his beard.  Thought entree should have been comped.  Served very apologetic.  Owner couldn't be bothered to come apologize.   Despite the decent tasting food, won't give this establishment another nickel.  There are far better restaurants with great food and superior customer service worth driving 20 minutes for.

-xmg379GisEhrUmDpPkjOg.text: Absolutely amazing!  Seriously, this is as good an Italian meal as we have ever had.  Don't think twice about where to go.  Go here.

ndCTmaToYNoUfQK_5LQrUw.text: Trying out the new Italian place close to home. Decided to go with the antipasto and a pizza. The antipasto was delish!!! Definitely get it. The pizza was good... the dough was more bready than chewy. I prefer chewy - like back home in NY.  Next visit will be to try out some entrees.

There is quite a large selection of Italian food, pasta, salads and some excellent looking pizzas. I had a terrific daily special chicken and pasta that was huge. Definitely will return!

VlKSvBgj_gEonMZ8Sf1fbg.text: Service was attentive and good.  My unsweet tea was always keep fill or another tea awaited.  The garlic cheese bread was plentiful and almost too much for one person.  My tortellini with alferdo was delicious and pipping hot.  Now the cannelloni looks good too. Great Italian food and nice price.

1ucuwJknc4MttrPM3XfnLw.text: As the garlic rests on my tongue all I can say is YUM.   Baked ziti was huge! Enough for me to eat on for two days. I wasn't expecting that. The cheese bread was lightly melted mozzarella with bites of real garlic on cut up Italian bread and served with a marinara that was made for dipping this. This marinara had a different taste than the baked ziti sauce. This impresses me because that is attention to detail.   Different dishes have different flavor filled sauces. This is important when ordering Italian dishes.   I ordered from UberEats. Thank you for delivery! I'm in my 18-wheeler so unique places other than pizza that deliver is always welcomed because I can't drive to many of these restaurants in that big ol body.

V5H6hdCw2oc3QpqIkXOjsg.text: Favorite local place in Steele Creek! We've gone for a casual pizza/salad family dinner but also a sweet date night with cocktails at the bar. The food is Fantastic! Shrimp scampi and gladiator pizza top our list.

_xfpN8qbyfV3Dwh93uHzyQ.text: This little gem is tucked away near a grocery store and pet supply store in a strip mall. So you think it can't be that good, you would be totally wrong. The service is great and the food and drinks are top notch. The pizzas are so great you'd think you were in the old country. Now the hand tossed are darn good but the Sicilian are even better and that's hard to imagine. The Stromboli's and calzones are colossal in size and if you leave this place hungry that's your fault. It's hard for me to say this (being a big meat eater) the salads and antipasto are the things that dreams are made of. If you don't go here and decide to go to Olive Garden I feel sorry for you.

pAnyigxOcXwCyw-nlaRnYg.text: I haven't tried any bad plate so far. Reasonable price, pizza and wings are delicious. Pesto sauce is yummy. Hard to find an Italian restaurant that is not overpriced. Recommended 100%

crJsfMGcVG_9Jv1vmPO1pA.text: This not just my favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte, it's my favorite restaurant! The food is awesome, the service top notch. Love it.

SK4EwsZ76nIg5xBYlMxYzw.text: LOVE this place. Great for a quick, inexpensive date night with a charming environment and absolutely delicious food on a rather large plate. If you want to eat like an Italian and enjoy the authentic taste, go here. If you want bland, commercialized italian food with a fake smile, go to ogdn.

d3g6nOWMjwvvkH9L8jG1Zw.text: The Italian foodie food snob is here to say: four stars!!  Whoohoo!  A good place for Italian food in Charlotte-rare and hard to come by, because the south is not where it's at for Italian food.    I came on a Saturday night and it was steady, but not crowded.  We were sat and greeted right away.  The service was meh...the waiter seemed a little out of it and slow.  He got a few things on our order wrong, which was slightly annoying, but tolerable.    I ordered eggplant parm and meatballs.  It comes with bread and a side salad.  Also we tried the calamari for an appetizer.  The calamari was good, the marinara for dipping was up to my standards and even had chunks of garlic in it.  I really enjoyed the marinara further on my main dish.  The flavor is perfect.  The eggplant was nice and cheesy, fresh and hot.  The pasta was cooked well.  I am a big fan of the meatballs, they were delish!  The salad and the bread weren't bad.  The bread was a little dry.      Overall a good experience and I liked the food a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States

Md60mbkU_-VdXvuUb6rm4g.text: This was a nice little Italian place.   I'd had a craving for Italian and decided to give this place a try. The menu is pretty extensive, most of your common dishes with some surprises.   I started with an order of calamari. They were good. No complaints, but the marinara sauce that comes with it was delicious. It's so good you'll want a bowl of it by itself. They also bring out rolls to start the meal. I wish they would have been warm or another type of bread better for dipping.    For dinner I ordered the chicken parm. It was classic. The chicken was nice a crispy and then topped with sauce an cheese. I also added a side of meatballs - the order comes with three and these were definitely the star of the evening. They packed so much flavor! And they tasted even better on the second day. #winning  Overall, this is a pretty solid place. I look forward to coming back, there were a few dishes that I saw come out the kitchen that I can't wait to try!

aHCTkGYjDLMQ25uQyvClQg.text: Decent little Italian place in the quickly developing area by the outlets, but the atmosphere is too fast-casual for the more extensive menu.   Similar to many other strip mall Italian restaurants where you see pizza options displayed when you walk in, the minimalist decor and lack of sound absorption made this a bit louder and less comfortable than expected.   An $8 10" vegetarian pizza was chock full of toppings and the crust had a nice crispness on the bottom, so a good value. The pasta dish we ordered was tasty and filling for $13. Bread and salad were run of the mill and unfortunately the service was a bit lacking, as we had to ask three time for our drinks (water), which were finally brought out with the food.   Nothing outstanding about this place good or bad, it just seems to blend into the background when considering the variety and quality of culinary options around the metro area. Could be good for families or groups and the small patio could be nice in the warmer months. Local beers represented on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States

awJpJ7x0nmKpjBfl7vpxxA.text: I've been wanting to try this place since they opened. I've heard some many mixed opinions about their food that I had to check them out. My friend and I decided to come for lunch on a Friday. We got there around 12:20pm and the restaurant wasn't too busy. We decided to sit on the outside area that was pretty nice. I chose the gnocchi and my friend the crab dip. Gnocchi is one of my favorites kind of foods so I had  to try theirs. The gnocchi was hard and the sauce was acidity was way too much besides there was a hair in my food. The food my friend ordered she liked it and I tried and it was good too. When I was almost done with my meal the waitress came with my bread that she was supposed to bring with my gnocchi. I didn't even wasted my time complaining about the hair in my meal because wasn't worth it.  As a matter of fact nothing was worth it in this visit. This is one of the few places I will never go back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gnocchi... Not good and came with a hair in it.

7qTGJIQQSJEOkX-nAtYf1g.text: Had an excellent lunch here!  Server was absolutely wonderful!  The food was so delicious and I felt like I needed a nap afterwards! Hahah  Pizza is on point and the sandwiches are killer!  Everyone in my party was super impressed!  Will be back to work through the rest of the delicious menu!

5RxuQMMfVLPmj6L1lVlMOw.text: This was a pleasant surprise!  I was in town for work and just happened to see this place close to my hotel.  Ordered the order the Alfredo with fettuccine and chicken.  Food was served fast and hot.  Hands down one of the best white sauces I've ever had.  Fettuccine was perfect as well as the chicken.  Staff was very attentive and I never had to ask for anything.  The inside is a little on the smaller side, but they also have an outside dining area as well.  The atmosphere is causal and fun.  I will definitely visit this location again the next time I'm in Charlotte and would recommend Enrico's to anyone that loves Italian food!

2rAq_YrnTqHwyJQA4SwmBA.text: We go there every Friday love the good the staff is great and enricos is awesome  We have spread the word to all our friends how great this  place.  Try the Sicilian pizza awesome.

zasoSuCIDmIeLACeXRob4w.text: I love this place! It's a great spot to grab some Italian without spending an arm and a leg. I love how quickly this place adapted to steele creek. The prices are great. The food is great and the service is excellent!

rT01iSMKX-kCJOUnIw-duw.text: Ate here with the fam tonight and it far exceeded our expectations! Our server (April) was great and the food was delicious.  We will definitely be back!

Jkd52MbC9Acd7_dKJddU_Q.text: This is hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte. I've been here probably 10 times for lunch since my office is really close by. I had been talking about it for so long, my fiance wanted to go. We went last night and it blew him away. The food is just always delicious, cooked or baked to perfection, always a generous portion and the service is always friendly and attentive. 10/10 highly recommend! Try the baked ziti, chicken parmigiana, pizza, calzone, or anything really. You won't regret it!!!  Also I want to add that the ambiance and decor is PERFECT. We absolutely appreciate not having the cheap fake vines or grapes or whatever else crap decor you find in an olive garden type place. Enricos is the real deal.

ferJuunQPRADiADZfOmS6g.text: Meh... I'd stop and grab a pizza, they looked pretty good. The menu was pretty big, staff friendly. Stopped in because it's close to home and we got frustrated that we couldn't find parking where we wanted to eat in Southend... we should have kept trying. The inside of Enrico's is very stark, someone has had some overly bright pics of Italy put on canvas at Office Depot and hung them awkwardly - that's the extent of the 'decor'. I realize it's just a simple place, but a few nice pieces of art and live plants would help. And it desperately needs some fabric/textiles - on a window, floor, something - the acoustics are horrible. Hard to hear your dining partner as all conversation around you is bouncing off cement walls and floor. Bathroom needs help in every way - sink too low, looks 20 years old, faucet didn't work correctly, towel dispenser didn't work.  Salad was very good - comes with plastic take out container of dressing, sister shubert rolls come with little butter things like at a diner (only after we asked). Yet they charge what a high end place would for their entrees. They are overpriced for the type of place/atmosphere/food. Fra Diavolo is one of my favorite Italian dishes - I almost always order it when I see it on the menu. Let's start with the positives: the shrimp were delicious and cooked right. The linguine was al dente. However, the mussels were so tiny they were almost nonexistent; not worth the trouble to get a toddler's thumbnail size piece of meat. Evenso, all would have been fine but someone was so heavy handed with the red pepper flakes, I had to constantly drink water and sniff (I wanted to drink my wine and would have ordered more), and no other flavors of the dish came through at all because the red pepper was so overpowering. It was hard to eat and was very oily. I would not try it again; I left most of it and ate cereal when we got home - not worth $17. My fiance had lobster ravioli, and it was pretty good, not spectacular. All in all ok little place, I would def stop in for a pizza but if I got pasta again I think I'd keep it simple. I'd love to see them up their game to match their menu prices - I hate all the chain junk Berewick has installed; we need nice little spots on this side of town!

HAMSCtYKFf-xO_Ms-Klrgw.text: It's a decent option for relatively cheap Italian with generous portions of starches.   1. My salmon pasta contained MAYBE a few shreds of salmon and was predominantly pasta in a semi-creamy tomato sauce.  It was basically a penne in a thin rosa. 2. The pizza was edible - filling and pretty standard.  It's an option if you are just looking for something filling and relatively inexpensive (pastas are around $10-14).

MtBCJt6OFX3HMNWSg5my6g.text: Had a lady in the area tell us about this restaurant. We wanted something light for lunch - so it was ice tea and green salad.   The salad was large. Homemade dressing plus came with homemade rolls.   Looking at the size of some of the items they are huge.   Seems very popular with the locals.   Good service- good food - clean restrooms it's a 4.

qbIhiA5VKXNswDFqyVApoQ.text: Decided to give this place another try this time actually heading there to sit down and eat.   I think the restaurant has a great ambience and the server was super friendly. The menu has a wide range of options from pasta to pizza to salads to Stromboli.   I had the buffalo chicken soup (a special)  and then the lasagna as my main dish. My partner had a Caesar salad and Alfredo with grilled chicken.   Sadly I wasn't that impressed again. The buffalo chicken soup was a unique concept and tasted buffalo chicken dip so it wasn't bad. My partner said the caesar salad was great. However, the main dishes just lacked something.   The food is just bland to me. My lasagna was a great portion but it just wasn't amazing. I tasted my partners Alfredo sauce and it needed some salt or some pepper or something. It tasted like it was store bought.   I don't taste any love or authenticity in this food which I want to with it being in such a convenient location. I won't be back and wish I tasted what everyone else was in these reviews!

p2dt8IAH8EQ7p3REXfATAg.text: Had a lunch date here with my friend a month or so ago. She suggested it since she used to work there AND HONEY! Let me tell YOU!!! The food was absolutely delicious!! The salmon caesar salad (w/o the olives) was the best salad I've had in a long time and I usually dislike going anywhere and paying over $5 for a bowl of lettuce. I also had some type of penne pasta with chicken and broccoli in it (chicken was added) and it was also to die for! So glad I was able to discover this place because I think I've found my new little lunch spot.

vreCQwiKKXsd8LcTO45zBQ.text: Glad to see this place is picking up traffic. It was a very busy night and the food is still spot on! The Pizza is very good but even the Pasta dishes are delicious. Definitely try as much on the menu as you can.

ztmK8987GXKvg_BHQ1XQbg.text: What a great find! This place is phenomenal!  Not much to look at from the moment you walk in but you'll feel at home with family once seated.  The portions are enormous and delicious. We had the antipasto and crab spinach dip for starters, both were delicious! For an entree I had the Diavola pizza and it was all that and a bag of chips! My wife had their lasagna and she said it was good but not memorable. Our friends shared Salmon il Padrino and they said it was deliciously good.  Great little restaurant with big delicious portions of authentic Italian food, we'll definitely be back when in want of a good home cooked Italian meal. Molto buono!

ALucQW3vl8NBxmcM8exDjA.text: Tasty , and a very cute spot in Steele Creek. Friendly service , plenty of room inside. Typical casual Italian eatery. I most enjoyed the salad with balsamic vinaigrette. This did not come with the entree I don't believe, I paid extra . My lasagna with meat sauce was beautiful. The sauce was sort of sweet, not bad, the layers however did not stick together well ( that's how I prefer lasagna, I know nothing about how it's supposed to be made).  I'm definitely wanting to go back and try the pizza by the slice, as well as the cute little bar they have .

CTbV321j39b2_iybRkOWQQ.text: We love this for Italian food.  Everything has been excellent.  Hard to find spaghetti bolognese anywhere but they have it, already no with veal parmesan, good pizza, great garlic knots, and so on.  We now have a place to get that Italian fix.

tZVAWMOwuvgU9KG7FkhheA.text: Nice experience. Service was fantastic. Our server was friendly and attentive and answered our questions. The restaurant is nice and clean.   I started off with the buffalo chicken soup. Our server did say it was amazing. Although the flavor wasn't bad, it was super watery and there was hardly anything in it. I didn't see any chicken or anything else in it. Just watery broth.   My friend got the caprese salad and she loved it. I got the lasagna as our meal and my friend got the pasta fagioli soup as her entree. Strange thing was we told the server that she wanted the soup as her entree but the brought the soup out before my lasagna. When my friend asked if they can take it back and wait when they brought out the lasagna, she said the back staff was going to give her a hard to for doing that and that once it's ready, they want it out of the kitchen. Strange. My lasagna was good, very cheesy and it had a lot of sauce. It came with rolls. Nothing special but just served with butter. I was going to get the spaghetti and meatballs as my entree but I asked if the meatballs were homemade (I hate frozen meatballs), she said they were NOT homemade. I was soooo surprised she said that but appreciated her honesty.   Overall, the experience was nice and pleasant.

Nothing super unique screams out and borders on chain Italian restaurant standards but definitely hit the spot!

JhxFmNfSGqLgEJ4VoLnFVA.text: Fabulous!!! Loved the food.   This place is a gem. Its very close to the Charlotte Premium Outlets and is a great addition. The inside is clean and fresh.   Lunch... Bread & Butter- Complimentary! Really yummy!!   Cesar Salad- I enjoyed the salad. The Cesar dressing was ok. Nothing to rave about. The ranch dressing was not even worth trying.   Fetechini Alfredo- light sauce no x cheese on top & side of mozzarella cheese - Incredible! Really good. Huge portions! Enough to have again for dinner.   For lunch, My friend got... Calamari- She loved it! 10 it off 10.   Spaghetti with sauce- She liked it so much she ate it again for left over dinner and she hardly ever eats leftovers. She did say the sauce was a tad sweet.

U-Zy5-E5hOkp0kp8-tjLaA.text: Enrico's is small, quaint and a great addition to the steele creek food scene that has quite a bit of growing to do. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was that the place smelled like someone's old Italian grandmother was in the kitchen! The aroma was absolutely breathtaking and I couldn't wait to try the food!  The menu is massive! Pizza, pastas, sandwiches, salads... Basically everything you'd expect to see at an Italian restaurant. There were a lot of things that I want to try so I can't wait to go back. I got the chicken cacciatore and my wife got the eggplant parmasen. Both were delicious. The pasta was amazing and seemed hand made. The vegetables and white wine sauce were perfect. I can't wait to go back!   Pros: - Food is extremely authentic - Side salads are HUGE - Entrees are HUGE and after the side salad I couldn't even come close to finishing. Good for at least 2 meals.  - Their DELICIOUS bread is unlimited - You can choose your pasta type with the pasta dishes - Pasta was al dente... Cooked to perfection.   Cons: - A bit small. Three large parties came in and that was it - No cocktail menu (I'm not that creative with my liquor and I need help lol

hkA5e0QqguofN-OVKFJwwA.text: Stopped in for lunch today and was seated back I the corner next to a wine fridge. The layout of the place is odd. It's like it's a pop up restaurant and they just scattered tables around the room. It needs a wall or something separating the dining area. There are a few pictures of Italy but the environment seems quite sterile compared to most Italian places I've been in.  There's full bar in the back as well and a counter where I assume can get take out orders.  The menu is broad and includes Italian specialties, pizza and sandwiches. I was craving a cheesesteak and went with that and added marinara sauce to o it.  When it came out, the sandwich looked promising. The roll was soft and may have been homemade. The meat was cut up well and provolone was melted on top of the meat. Onions on the bottom and marinara on top of the cheese.   The onions could have been cooked longer as they were still raw. I prefer my onions to be carmelized and these were slightly steamed. The meat was lacking something...maybe salt and pepper. Sauce was good but there needed to be more cheese. It was an Ok sandwich but not close to anything you find near Philly.   I'd like to come back and try some of their other options but the sterile environment may keep me away. I think there are better, more comfortable places around Charlotte.

YhBhsyblPYvB38BWAnM3gQ.text: Really enjoyed the food.  Calamari was hot, no tentacles and so tasty, served with lemon wedges and marina.  Enjoyed a sangria along with complimentary warm rolls.  The small calzone was filled with cheese and big enough for two.   Service was great, food excellent and got a tad noisy but the place was packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Enricos - Charlotte, NC, United States. Must have a cannoli!

XqyxnlvdzHqwKZcGXUP66A.text: Great hot food! Presentation was very lovely for delivery. They forgot my dressing for the salad but it's all good (I have my own). I would def recommend their chicken parm & cheesy bread. The cheesy bread is so good and warm. The chicken that is served with the parm is big and juicy. I'm glad I opted for this. I wanna try the BBQ chicken pizza next time. Oh! It's also enough for two people. I couldn't finish it.   My bf opted for the chicken Alfredo but that...needs some salt & love. It just wasn't seasoned enough. The chicken tasted boiled. Black pepper and salt will save it though. I wouldn't order it personally.   All in all, I will order from Enrico's again.

x90IiphPOj8cSgyU4QhZHA.text: Good place to eat staffs are friendly.  Came here with family after shopping.  We like it.      It's nice quite place. I don't like crowds so it's good for me. We will come back.

Bb7bOw1v6sMHjqxgPMQQhQ.text: Great customer service and welcoming!. The workers are very down-to-earth and the food is amazing. I ate the calamari for an app and as an entree i ate the blackened chicken broccoli penne pasta alfredo which is to die for! Please visit this restuarant you will not regret it.

PXTz0u5D8tKXo5YnzlaNkQ.text: We have been twice and really liked it... we just stopped for appetizers and a glass of wine both times, so we especially like it now that they have their ABC license and will be stocking a full bar.   The first time we sat outside and the patio is very comfy and last night we sat at the bar with Chad and he took extra wonderful care of us. Maria, the manager, also checked on us throughout both meals to make sure we enjoyed everything. The pizza was pretty delicious, especially the cheese, and it was fun to watch the owner and the other chef making pizzas and other goodies. The marinara is yummy for the garlic knots and I realllllly loved the shrimp scampi. I really want that over some angel hair pasta next time! Or the chicken parm, which I was eyeing at the neighboring table and looked deeelish!   We don't have kids, but it is family friendly for those who do.

hYrviL15y7nyMqYwiU6E1g.text: I can't comment on the service because we have only ever ordered to go (we live 2 mins down the road). However, I am so thankful to have a place close by that is actually worth the money. It's very hard for a lot of southern restaurants to impress me (I'm from NY and I came from a straight off the boat Italian family)- but Enricos really impressed me big time. The sauce is perfect! The bread is fresh and actually quite delicious.

IXS9oas6CvRzivJN7CZpuA.text: Was there yesterday, Tina was my waitress, very good, had been waiting for them to open, had Bolognese spaghetti, very good and a lot of food, the salad was also good, had lemon pepper dressing (which I had never had before) that they make there, a large menu, lots of things to try.....

npqq56A1wBZzIXqEK2K3lg.text: Enrico's just opened in the Berewick Town Center. I am so happy to finally have a sit down restaurant that isn't a fast food joint. My waiter today was Jesus, he was amazing and very helpful when recommending something to try. In regards to the soup of the day I went with his recommendation for the creamy chicken soup with garlic. The soup was amazing, very flavorful in a nice creamy sauce. As far as the entree, I went with alfredo with chicken. With the entree comes a salad fyi. In regards to the alfredo, initially it came out a bit too soupy for me, but I requested that the sauce be made thicker and when it came back out it was 100% better. They have such a large menu, I will definitely  be back to try other options, I know there is something I will fall in love with. The menu includes, pasta, pizza, calzones, plenty of appetizer choices as well as dessert. There is also a kids menu. They will also have some type of bar, not sure if they have a liquor license but they were stocking bottles of wine while I was there today.

T1A_KMr8h3HfJGqlpdVdlw.text: Love it!!! The food the service the atmosphere! Everything is great !!! I highly recommend everyone try it !

DTQ1db1nbXTvGholowpKsg.text: The Sicilian Pizza and Stromboli were awesome. We are from up north and have not had good pizza since we move to Charlotte a year ago. Pleasantly surprised at how good it was! By far the best pizza we've had since being here.

vSGKZ7WUTb1nCXN6qenTCg.text: Just finished my meal at Enrico's with my family and we loved it! Our waitress was Rochelle and she very nice and overall great. We tried the Crab and spinach dip as an appetizer and we all enjoyed it so I definitely recommend it. My grandparents both got Italian sausage and they really enjoyed because it reminded them of home. I had the fettuccine alfredo and my dad the tortellini alfredo which was really good it's a nice good authentic alfredo sauce. My sister got a pizza with bacon and she couldn't stop eating it! Enrico's is a great place and l it is one of the very few Italian restaurants in the Steele Creek area so I definitely recommend trying it out!

K4V59VUxYk57_CNRnB_v3g.text: Best Stromboli!!  And pizza is good Especially for the south and I'm from the north where pizza is king.  I bet after some time when the ovens get seasoned it will be

Q0dzF8Vxk_i_4z9RsBsL1w.text: Have to say I was impressed.  Good food is this area is hard to find so I wasn't expecting it to be that good. We had the spinach dip, a pasta and a pizza. Everything was tasty and service was good!

MwldrXe5geteLIxqGboTSA.text: Very good Italian restaurant!  Great service and great food.  The baked ziti was awesome.

EENUkZD4tqRzLAW-0DIv6A.text: Gnocchi!...all you need to know. Trust me, Terry J knows. Love this place. The bald guy that is always there is very personable and one heck of a cook.

OQnJKTHAai7X3PWA5WbkoQ.text: We ordered a Chicken limonatta - chicken wasn't cooked well, veg lasagna instead of the layered dish was spread out and tasteless, eggplant parmigiana had a strange taste. Overall the oil used wasn't great quality. Left an after taste.

AnmBmMtGePdGDrrtkJRzHQ.text: We arrived about 5 pm Tuesday. Not crowded. We were greeted at the door and shown to a table by the window.  Two waters, and bread were delivered fast. Our order of large Calzone and two salads was taken. The salads arrived in a few minutes and it was a plate full. All fresh. The Calzone arrived as big as a large pizza! 1/2 went home as lunch for tomorrow.  The sauce and cheese had great flavor. I did not have room for desert. They have a bar and craft beers. So under 35$ and we got 4 meal. Great food and service.

d0BjHXSZ6kEyfnzO2xslQQ.text: We went on a whim and were amazed! Spectacular service! We absolutely enjoyed everything about our dining experience including the Chianti recommended by the bartender, calamari, Pasta, balsamic dressing and hot bread! The portions were enough to share and the pricing was affordable- especially when you can share! Great family and or date night with indoor and outdoor seating. We will drive back from Belmont to enjoy this Italian delight!

BMe5M7G951QFhZe0nAlcmA.text: Be careful when go in this place they change there menu and there prices like the stock mart .. Food is just average..no effort in being consistent ..I tried to support this place because I leave in the area.. but when you show no love you get none.. they'll be out of business soon with this type of operation..

s4K0GrsjgDmKkEdhORcoNQ.text: Great food and large portions...u won't go hungry.  REALLY good service.  They make sure everything is good and check up on you.  Good Tap  selection.  Our server Fernando was really good.  Will visit again when back from Cincinnati, OH.

jKLS9wSHPQb5vGrdGYnYew.text: Caught this place by surprise. Looks brand new decided to give it a try.  Very happy I did.  Food was awesome service was excellent. I had clams scampi as an appetizer and penne bolognaise.  Just terrific. Best of luck.

IWpW4xKWzvNVlsmiYl8i4g.text: Absolutely love having a independently owned restaurant (not a chain) right here in Berewick.  There isn't anything I have ordered yet that I don't love with leftovers to take home.  But let me just say...their garlic knots-best I've ever had.  Great little snack to pick up on the way home.  Staff is so nice.  I hope they succeed!

hrK1pM7ZkoMAGrEM2DdwBw.text: I arrived from out of state and needed a nice place to eat. This place was wonderful quality and the place was extremely clean. You will not be disappointed. It is reasonably priced and the service was very good. I would come back here in a heartbeat.  I could not be more pleased.

pmrVOawtVcxEeb-9K0-_nw.text: Went today for lunch and give this place 3.5 stars. The smell of cleaner was a bit over whelming when I walked in but otherwise nice atmosphere. I got the fettuccini Alfredo with chicken and tiramisu - both pretty good. Service was good and portion size nice. Would have liked warmed rolls that were served prior to meal to be warmed and butter to be soft. Would go back.

w66y8SBUlAhcNE5cLvibhw.text: Stopped in here for a lunch meeting & I was glad i did! I had the lasagna and it was hands down the best I have ever had! I'm not a big lasagna but this was the bomb! Flavorful & well portioned! My fr md had the Stromboli. He said it was good, but the bread was cooked hard otherwise it would have been a 5 star. Service was friendly & very prompt.

E1awJM0Bo4yc22JYQOsGvg.text: Can you tell your food and Rico's was very good. I had the salmon with a cream sauce it was delicious. My wife had some type of chicken dish that was also delicious. My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs and there wasn't an ounce of noodles left on the plate. My son try to eat the chicken Parmesan but it was way too much so we have plenty of food to take home. Overall a Rico's is a very nice Italian restaurant. Great for family great for kids.

0WhFTn7Ac_yPThIfVxEtzw.text: My family like to try new restaurants. The food was great. Prices very good. My kid really enjoyed it.

Mwme7i7pAy_11PwIPkW9Rg.text: Came for dinner with my wife and 21 mo old sold, staff was great, food was fantastic, we all LOVED our pasta. Service was great and the food came very quickly. Prices are fantastic for great Italian food, will be coming back again as there where ALOT of other things in the menu that we wanted to try

H2q2e_HUwTqA0ZkswLjv5A.text: Had lunch here yesterday  Every thing was excellent Food and Prices are very very good Sunday afternoon was crowded Good vibe and nice  atmosphere Will go back often

sMocA5N-HF6IvvXfDZGxdA.text: I finally decided to try Enrico's tonight, after hearing mixed reviews first-hand from a coworker.   I ordered the Sorrento Pasta opting for penne and added chicken.  The menu pictured on yelp describes that dish as "sauteed fresh tomatoes with garlic with our fresh melted mozzarella." What I got was a pureed tomato sauce over penne and bland chicken that tasted like it was pre-made hours ago. I wouldn't mind paying 10 bucks for a meal like this in a mall food court or family diner, but to be charged $17 for this and store bought bread is a rip-off. Maybe they focus all their energy on their pizzas.....

43IZG7jwkVtBU1BbnyQ1Yg.text: I was a little hesitant trying this new restaurant in its first week of opening, but we had a very good experience. The staff greeted us as soon as we walked in, and sat us right down. Three different people asked if we needed anything while we waited for our dinner. The food was very tasty.  We will definitely go back and try more of their menu

Jbm52wuO7TruDyZgWeGUzQ.text: What a nice surprise. Drive by frequently and made the stop. Almost everything is homemade and our selections were yummy. Mary was very informative, helped us make great choices, she's a keeper. The chef/owner is from Naples and cooking from his authentic Italian roots. Almost didn't want to share this with everyone but I want to see a much needed restaurant be successful! We'll be regulars!

Q6F0YCKtQlxY5fL2xdDmpw.text: Had your 'za take it for Valentine's Day dinner and it was great! We also got the garlic knots but I'll pass on those next time! I will absolutely be coming back for your pizza. Prices aren't too bad, either!!

9UcVNU-ZwUuTLoP_b35i4w.text: I recently moved to the Carolinas. I've been here a few times and I absolutely love it. The owners are fabulous and the food is very good. I would definitely recommend this place. It's good for family and parties.

CfcsAgC8-UPRbWi9j1Lq2g.text: Good Italian food and pizza. The white pizza is so yummy and I like their pasta dishes always get the Caesar salad and it's yummy

pR4NZWWLZ3PMGb4MsAmcYQ.text: I enjoyed the FOOD. I was able to get a wonderful pink sauce, yum! Will definitely return. The shrimp bisque soup is excellent!

ReHmrIyTdLHOcfJU5hsB3w.text: First time coming here their cease salad is really good.They also make the bread there. I got the fettuccine Alfredo it was ok could use a little more seasoning.

EXwWyfL6-yJp62vzhWgxjA.text: Food was delicious! Every little detail from the balsamic dressing to the fresh baked bread was phenomenal! We'll be back!

_IvNf9hq-P2KLn7tM_7DEw.text: A great fast/casual Italian restaurant near the outlets. Having just moved out near the lake, there were a number of times when a quick pizza, veal parm, chicken piccata, or the stromboli sounded like a good dinner option.  The food has always been good. Decent portions at the right price. The bread and pizza dough is delicious. The red sauce cane be a little thin, more so just with the pasta. The fettuccini Alfredo is also good, but a little light on the sauce. Regardless, it's my go to for a quick take out dinner and occasionally a quick sit down dinner.  The decor is modern minimalist (lots of grays, lots of wood, lots of gray wood).  The bar area is small but they have excellent bartenders and are well stocked. A small but solid wine and beer list.  This will continue to be a regular pick for midweek take out!

b5hlRMQ-DvmSmH-vNC-ktg.text: Great addition to the growing Berewick area.  The pizza and pasta both are delicious. Love having somewhere I can either dine in or out near by. Definitely check this place out.

7oMKLih6omBCkPRT4jaWDw.text: We love this place! The marinara sauce is the best in the world! Good enough to eat with a spoon. The service is friendly and prompt and this place has that genuine, fresh food feel. Definitely try Enricos! You won't be disappointed.

8L6Blm2EQwtay5mafGbW3A.text: The place is loud. The food is just ok. Sauces were watery. I had the bolognese and it was more like spaghetti sauce. Meat tasted old. Waitress rushed us through our meal. Disappointing.

vxeH0LNW-gOY_JmIgZF0_w.text: Awesome!  Hugh portions and so good!  Wife and I had 2 dinners, 2 glasses of wine ...$43 bucks!  Please, please come open up a 2nd location in Lake Wylie !
